title: History of the United States (1945–1964)
summary: For the United States, 1945–1964 was a time of high economic growth and general prosperity. It was also a time of confrontation as the capitalist United States and its allies politically opposed the Soviet Union and other communist states; the Cold War had begun. African Americans united and organized, and a triumph of the Civil Rights Movement ended Jim Crow segregation in the Southern United States.[1] Further laws were passed that made discrimination illegal and provided federal oversight to guarantee voting rights.
